page.title: 11The Holderness Diary - 2
page.content:
CONTENTS OF ISSUE 19 - JUNE 1985
The Front Page article offers information about the Withernsea Rifle Club. Withernsea is the nearest coastal resort to Burton Pidsea. Page Two is taken up entirely with the article on Local History - a new, regular feature. The title of this particular feature is "Our Shrinking Shores" and it is concerned with the villages of Holderness lost to coastal erosion. Regular features spread through the paper include a crossword puzzle, Letter's Column, Diary of Events and Information, a "Birdwatch" Column and a story of "Old Murder". This tells of a vicar of Owthorne who was murdered in 1708 by a man he had taken in as an orphan; killed because he refused to allow his daughter to marry the man.
